articles.title: A C.I.A. Fighter, a Somali Bomb Maker, and a Faltering Shadow War - The New York Times
articles.description: The hunt for an elusive Somali militant illustrates why Al Shabab, despite a decade of American covert action, are at their strongest in years.
articles.content:
American analysts estimate that Al Shabab command anywhere from 5,000 to 10,000 fighters. Under Mr. Mohamed, their bombs have grown more sophisticated and powerful.

articles.description: Why cancer stigma for Asian Americans is so dangerous -- especially in the age of Covid-19 and coronavirus
articles.content:
My husband and I were doing what married couples do in bed after a romantic anniversary dinner. An odd look suddenly crossed his face.
Whats wrong? I asked.
I just felt a small lump on your breast.… [+5681 chars]
